intro: Ceropegia tuberculata, commonly known as the velvet plant or African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Ceropegia tuberculata is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
